[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [State Consistency] [Partial Execution] If script execution fails midway, can PreviousResult references to failed calls cause undefined behavior? (High)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Error Handling] [Change Operation Type Error] When change_op_type() returns Err, is the original CallArgument left in a consistent state? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Error Handling] [Invalid Argument Type] Does the error message 'Unexpected argument type, can only borrow from previous function results' leak information that could aid attackers? (Low)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Metadata] [Multiple Versions] Can a script have multiple ComposerVersion metadata entries, causing confusion about which version to use? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Metadata] [Missing Metadata] Can scripts without APTOS_SCRIPT_COMPOSER_KEY metadata be processed as composer scripts, bypassing security checks? (High)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Move VM] [Ability Checking] Are ability checks (copy, drop, key, store) properly enforced for types referenced in CallArgument and PreviousResult? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Move VM] [Resource Safety] Can PreviousResult violate Move's resource safety guarantees by allowing resources to be copied or dropped inappropriately? (Critical)
[File: aptos-move/script-composer/src/lib.rs] [Move VM] [Reference Safety] Can borrow and borrow_mut operations create dangling references or violate Move's reference safety rules? (Critical)
